inputs.subheading: <u>Exclusion Criteria</u>: If any of the following are true, the CCHR does not apply
<u>High Risk Criteria</u>: Rules out need for neurosurgical intervention
inputs.label_en: short-term memory problems, or persistent anterograde amnesia.
Two hours following the injury, GCS <15.
inputs.name: glasgow_coma_score

inputs.label_en: Possible fracture to the skull that is open or depressed.
inputs.name: fracture

inputs.label_en: Any indications of a fractured basilar skull?
inputs.name: basilar_fracture
inputs.tips_en: Hemotympanum, raccoon eyes, Battle’s Sign, CSF oto-/rhinorrhea

inputs.subheading: <u>Medium Risk Criteria</u>: In addition to above, rules out “clinically important” brain injury (positive CT's that normally require admission)

inputs.label_en: Retrograde amnesia to the event ≥ 30 minutes
inputs.name: amnesia
danger_mechanism
inputs.tips_en: Pedestrian struck by motor vehicle, occupant ejected from motor vehicle, or fall from >3 feet or >5 stairs.
